name: jarringly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is jarring (= having a strong and unpleasant effect because it is so different from what is usual or expected that it seems wrong): The song feels jarringly out of place here. The precarious co-existence of different cultures is jarringly apparent wherever you go.
More examplesFewer examplesHe looks his age, jarringly so, since we still think of him as a young man.The final story is so jarringly different in tone and subject that it should not have been included.The tone shifts, jarringly, from arch to earnest.
